text:
Your Apple Watch measures
activity using three rings:
move, exercise, and stand.
WatchOS 7 and later updates

have the option to change
all three activity goals.
If you have an earlier WatchOS,
you're only able to change the move goal.
We'll show you both options.
First, to change your move goal,

navigate to the activity
app on your Apple Watch.
Long press on the activity rings.
A pop-up will appear.
Tap "Change Move Goal."
Here, you can press a plus or minus sign
to increase or decrease your calorie goal.
Press "Update" once you've confirmed
your desired calorie goal.
To change your exercise and stand goals,
you must have WatchOS 7 or later.
To change these goals,
go back to your activity app.

Scroll to the bottom
and tap "Change Goals."
Here, you can also change the move goal,
exercise goal, and stand goal.
Press "Next" after setting each goal,
followed by "OK" to finish the process.
To close the circle,
meet or exceed your activity goals.
